name: CQ.Ext.chart.NumericAxis
doc: A type of axis whose units are measured in numeric values.

props.name: adjustMaximumByMajorUnit
props.doc:
Indicates whether to extend maximum beyond data's maximum to the nearest
majorUnit.

props.name: adjustMinimumByMajorUnit
props.doc:
Indicates whether to extend the minimum beyond data's minimum to the
nearest majorUnit.

props.name: alwaysShowZero
props.doc:
If true, and the bounds are calculated automatically, either the minimum
or maximum will be set t...

props.name: calculateByLabelSize
props.doc:
Indicates whether to factor in the size of the labels when calculating a
major unit.

props.name: hideOverlappingLabels
props.doc: If true, labels that overlap previously drawn labels on the axis will be hidden.

props.name: labelFunction
props.doc:
A string reference to the globally-accessible function that may be called to
determine each of th...

props.name: labelSpacing
props.doc: The space, in pixels, between labels on an axis.

props.name: majorUnit
props.doc: The spacing between major intervals on this axis.

props.name: maximum
props.doc:
The maximum value drawn by the axis. If not set explicitly, the axis
maximum will be calculated a...

props.name: minimum
props.doc:
The minimum value drawn by the axis. If not set explicitly, the axis
minimum will be calculated a...

props.name: minorUnit
props.doc: The spacing between minor intervals on this axis.

props.name: orientation
props.doc: The direction in which the axis is drawn. May be "horizontal" or "vertical".

props.name: position
props.doc: Indicates the position of the axis relative to the chart

props.name: reverse
props.doc: If true, the items on the axis will be drawn in opposite direction.

props.name: roundMajorUnit
props.doc: Indicates whether to round the major unit.

props.name: scale
props.doc:
The scaling algorithm to use on this axis. May be "linear" or
"logarithmic".

props.name: snapToUnits
props.doc:
If true, the labels, ticks, gridlines, and other objects will snap to the
nearest major or minor ...
